#!/opt/perl5/bin/perl

USCDB

  USCC Wrapper for DBI

AUTHOR

  Craig Stalsberg
  Pete Chudykowski

SYNOPSIS

  use USCDB; 
  
  my $uscdb = USCDB->new();
                                  # parameters optional if testing
                                  # in production-like environment
  my ($sid,$user,$pass) = $uscdb->getDBParmsfromOper($op_job, 
                                                     $op_sid,
                                                     $op_user, 
                                                     $op_pass); 
  unless ($uscdb->openConnection($sid,$user,$pass))
  {
      carp "Could not connect to Oracle!", 
                    $uscdb->getErrorStr(), "\n\n";
  }
require 5.004;
require Exporter;

use DBI;
use vars qw(@EXPORT);

package USCDB;

METHODS

new()

  Constructor.
  Creates an instance of USCDB.
  Sets the default class variables.
  
  Returns: a reference to the instanciated object.
sub new
{

    my $obj  = shift;
    my $self = {};
    my $dbh;

    $self->{'_dbh'}     = $dbh;
    $self->{'_errCode'} = 0;
    $self->{'_errStr'}  = "";
    bless($self, $obj);
    return $self;

}

openConnection()

  Creates an Oracle connection handle.
  Stores the handle in the _dbh instance variable.
  
  Takes:   sid  - Instance of DB to open
           user - User for connection.
           pass - Password for connection.
  
  Returns: defined on success
  Or:      undef on faliure
sub openConnection
{

    my ($self, $sid, $user, $pass) = @_;

    $self->{'_dbh'} =
      DBI->connect("dbi:Oracle:$sid", $user, $pass,
                   {PrintError => 0, AutoCommit => 0});
    if (!$self->{'_dbh'})
    {
        $self->{'_errCode'} = $DBI::err;
        $self->{'_errStr'}  = $DBI::errstr;
        return undef;
    }
    return defined;
}

setQuery()

  Parses the SQL query to run.
    
  Takes:   sql  - SQL query string
  
  Returns: defined on success
  Or:      undef on faliure
sub setQuery
{

    my ($self, $sql) = @_;

    my $dbh = $self->{'_dbh'};
    if (!defined $dbh)
    {
        $self->{'_errCode'} = $DBI::err;
        $self->{'_errStr'}  = $DBI::errstr;
        return undef;
    }

    my $sth = $dbh->prepare($sql);
    if (!defined $sth)
    {
        $self->{'_errCode'} = $DBI::err;
        $self->{'_errStr'}  = $DBI::errstr;
        return undef;
    }
    $self->{'_sth'} = $sth;

    return defined;
}

runQuery()

  Executes set SQL query.
    
  Takes:   bind_vars - optional array of bind variables.
  
  Returns: defined on success
        undef on faliure
sub runQuery
{

    my ($self, @bind_vars) = @_;

    my $sth = $self->{'_sth'};
    $rc = $sth->execute(@bind_vars);
    if (!defined $rc)
    {
        $self->{'_errCode'} = $DBI::errcode;
        $self->{'_errStr'}  = $DBI::errstr;
        return undef;
    }
    return defined;
}

fetchResults()

  Fetches next row of an executed query.
    
  Returns: defined on success
        undef on faliure
sub fetchResults
{

    $self = shift;
    my $sth = $self->{'_sth'};
    if (!defined $sth)
    {
        $self->{'_errCode'} = $DBI::err;
        $self->{'_errStr'}  = $DBI::errstr;
        return undef;
    }
    (@arr) = $sth->fetchrow_array();
    return @arr;
}

selectFetchRow()

  Parses, Executes and fetches a single row of 
  a query to run.
    
  Takes:   sql  - SQL query string
  
  Returns: @arr - returned row array
        undef on faliure
sub selectFetchRow
{
    my ($self, $sql) = @_;

    my $dbh = $self->{'_dbh'};
    if (!defined $dbh)
    {
        $self->{'_errCode'} = $DBI::err;
        $self->{'_errStr'}  = $DBI::errstr;
        return undef;
    }

    (@arr) = $dbh->selectrow_array($sql);
    if (@arr == 0)
    {
        $self->{'_errCode'} = $DBI::err;
        $self->{'_errStr'}  = $DBI::errstr;
        return undef;
    }
    return @arr;
}

fetchHash()

  Fetches next row of an executed query.
    
  Returns: HashRef - reference to a row hash.
                     The keys are column names,
                     the values are returned values.
        undef on faliure
sub fetchHash
{

    $self = shift;
    my $sth = $self->{'_sth'};
    if (!defined $sth)
    {
        $self->{'_errCode'} = $DBI::err;
        $self->{'_errStr'}  = $DBI::errstr;
    }
    $HashRef = $sth->fetchrow_hashref();
    return $HashRef;
}

getErrorCode()

  Retrieves a numeric error code.
    
  Returns: string - Error Code
sub getErrorCode
{
    $self = shift;
    return $self->{'_errCode'};
}

getErrorStr()

  Retrieves a string error message.
    
  Returns: string - Error Description
sub getErrorStr
{
    $self = shift;
    return $self->{'_errStr'};
}

displayError()

  Prints the Oracle Error Code and Message to STDERR.
sub displayError
{

    my $self = shift;
    my $errCode;
    my $errMsg;

    $errCode = $self->{'_errCode'};
    $errMsg  = $self->{'_errStr'};
    print STDERR "\nError Code: $errCode : $errMsg\n";

}

closeConnection()

  Terminates Oracle connection.
  Destroys Database Handle.
    
  Returns: defined on success
        undef on faliure
sub closeConnection
{

    $self = shift;

    my $dbh = $self->{'_dbh'};
    my $sth = $self->{'_sth'};

    if (defined $sth)
    {
        $sth->finish();
    }
    $dbh->disconnect();

}

DESTROY()

  Destroys the object blessed into $self.
sub DESTROY
{

    my $self = shift;
    my $dbh;
    my $sth;

    if (defined($self->{'_sth'}))
    {
        $sth = $self->{'_sth'};
        $sth->finish();
        undef $self->{'_sth'};
    }
    if (defined($self->{'_dbh'}))
    {
        $dbh = $self->{'_dbh'};
        $dbh->disconnect();
        undef $self->{'_dbh'};
    }
    undef $self->{'_errCode'};
    undef $self->{'_errStr'};

}

commit()

  Makes permanent changes made to the database.
    
  Returns: defined on success
        undef on faliure
sub commit
{

    my $self = shift;

    my $dbh = $self->{'_dbh'};
    my $rc = $dbh->commit() || warn "error: " . $dbh->errstr;
    return $rc;
}

rollback()

  Rolls back changes up to the most recent commit.
    
  Returns: defined on success
        undef on faliure
sub rollback
{

    my $self = shift;

    my $dbh = $self->{'_dbh'};
    my $rc = $dbh->rollback() || warn "error: " . $dbh->errstr;    
    return $rc;
}

quote()

  Quotes a string literal for use as a literal value 
  in an SQL statement.
    
  Takes:   lit - string literal
           dt  - data type
           
  Returns: quoted string
sub quote
{

    my $self = shift;
    my ($lit, $dt) = @_;

    my $dbh = $self->{'_dbh'};
    return $dbh->quote($lit, $dt) || warn "error: " . $dbh->errstr;
}

getDBHandle()

  Accessor Method.
            
  Returns: Database Handle reference
sub getDBHandle
{
    $self = shift;
    return $self->{'_dbh'};
}

quote()

  Dumps the entire result set of an executed 
  statement handle.
    
  Takes:  maxlen - max field length 
                   (optional, default: 35)
          lsep   - line separator 
                   (optional, default: "\n")
          fsep   - field separator 
                   (optional, default: ", ")
          fh     - output handle 
                   (optional, default: STDOUT)
  Returns: count of rows processed
sub dumpResults
{
    $self = shift;
    my $maxlen = shift;
    my $lsep   = shift;
    my $fsep   = shift;
    my $fh     = shift;

    return $self->{'_sth'}->dump_results($maxlen, $lsep, $fsep, $fh);
}

getDBParmsfromOper()

  Gets the Oracle Instance, Oracle User and Oracle Password from the 
  operational DB.  Use the JOB, Sid, User and Password that are passed
  as parameters to this function.  If they are not passed, then we use
  the environment variables setup containing these parameters.
  Takes  : $job  - operational job 
                   ( optional, default: $ENV{OP_JOB_NAME} )
           $sid  - operational database instance schema name 
                   ( optional, default: $ENV{OP_ORA_INST} )
           $user - user name 
                   ( optional, default: $ENV{OP_ORA_USER} )
           $pass - password
                   ( optional, default: $ENV{OP_ORA_PASS} )
  
  Returns: $sid  - database instance schema name 
           $user - user name 
           $pass - password
  Or     : undef on faliure
sub getDBParmsfromOper()
{

    my $self   = shift;
    my $job    = shift;
    my $opSid  = shift;
    my $opUser = shift;
    my $opPass = shift;

    unless (defined $job)    { $job    = $ENV{OP_JOB_NAME} }
    unless (defined $opSid)  { $opSid  = $ENV{OP_ORA_INST} }
    unless (defined $opUser) { $opUser = $ENV{OP_ORA_USER} }
    unless (defined $opPass) { $opPass = $ENV{OP_ORA_PASS} }

    my $rc = $self->openConnection($opSid, $opUser, $opPass);
    if (!defined $rc)
    {
        displayError();
        print STDERR "\nPerhaps OP_JOB_NAME, OP_ORA_INST, OP_ORA_USER, and ",
          "OP_ORA_PASS are not set for the local operational ", "schema?";
        return undef;
    }

    my $sql = "select dbc.db_instance, dbc.username, dbc.password ";
    $sql = $sql . "  from jobdbconnect jdbc, dbconfig dbc ";
    $sql = $sql . " where dbc.db_connect_code = jdbc.db_connect_code ";
    $sql = $sql . "   and jdbc.run_mode = 'F' ";
    $sql = $sql . "   and jdbc.job_name = '$job'";

    ($sid, $user, $pass) = $self->selectFetchRow($sql);
    if (!defined $sid)
    {
        displayError();
    }
    $self->closeConnection();
    return ($sid, $user, $pass);
}

getInfranetDBParmsfromOper()

  Much the same as getDBParmsfromOper() but looking for run_mode = 'F'.
  Get the Oracle Instance, Oracle User and Oracle Password for the 
  Database from the operational DB.  Use the JOB, Sid, User and Password 
  that are passed as parameters to this function.  If they are not passed,
  then we use the environment variables setup containing these parameters.
  Takes  : $job  - operational job 
                   ( optional, default: $ENV{OP_JOB_NAME} )
           $sid  - operational database instance schema name 
                   ( optional, default: $ENV{OP_ORA_INST} )
           $user - user name 
                   ( optional, default: $ENV{OP_ORA_USER} )
           $pass - password
                   ( optional, default: $ENV{OP_ORA_PASS} )
  
  Returns: $sid  - database instance schema name 
           $user - user name 
           $pass - password
  Or     : undef on faliure
sub getInfranetDBParmsfromOper()
{

    my $self   = shift;
    my $job    = shift;
    my $opSid  = shift;
    my $opUser = shift;
    my $opPass = shift;

    unless (defined $job)    { $job    = $ENV{OP_JOB_NAME} }
    unless (defined $opSid)  { $opSid  = $ENV{OP_ORA_INST} }
    unless (defined $opUser) { $opUser = $ENV{OP_ORA_USER} }
    unless (defined $opPass) { $opPass = $ENV{OP_ORA_PASS} }

    my $rc = $self->openConnection($opSid, $opUser, $opPass);
    if (!defined $rc)
    {
        $self->displayError();
        return undef;
    }

    my $sql = "select dbc.db_instance, dbc.username, dbc.password ";
    $sql = $sql . "  from jobdbconnect jdbc, dbconfig dbc ";
    $sql = $sql . " where dbc.db_connect_code = jdbc.db_connect_code ";
    $sql = $sql . "   and jdbc.run_mode = 'I' ";
    $sql = $sql . "   and jdbc.job_name = '$job'";

    ($sid, $user, $pass) = $self->selectFetchRow($sql);
    if (!defined $sid)
    {
        $self->displayError();
        print STDERR "\nPerhaps OP_JOB_NAME, OP_ORA_INST, OP_ORA_USER, and ",
          "OP_ORA_PASS are not set for the local operational ", "schema?";
    }
    $self->closeConnection();
    return ($sid, $user, $pass);
}

PROGRAMMING STYLE

SAMPLE CODE

This is just a simple example of how to use the USCDB Class. Please note that the first line (#!/opt/perl5/bin/perl) should be the first line of your file, you cannot have any blank lines or anything above it. Also, it should be the first character in the line, no leading spaces.

   #!/opt/perl5/bin/perl
   BEGIN {
      push(@INC, "/tmp_mnt/home/auto/mpsteam/lib");
   }
   # Load USCDB Module
   use USCDB;       
   
   # Create New Instance of Object                                                 
   $dbh = new USCDB();            
   
   # Connect to DB                                    
   $dbh->openConnection("pc1m01","m01appconn","m01appconn");          
   if (!defined $dbh) {
      $dbh->displayError();
   }
   # Select and display the current time
   $sql = "Select to_char(sysdate, 'HH24:MI:SS') from dual";          
   ($sysTime) = $dbh->selectFetchRow($sql);
   print STDOUT "Current System Time: $sysTime\n";
   # Build Query
   $sql = "Select ban, bill_cycle from billing_account";
   # Set Query
   $rc = $dbh->setQuery($sql);                                        
   if (!defined $rc) {
      $dbh->displayError();
   }
   # Run Query
   $rc = $dbh->runQuery();                                            
   if (!defined $rc) {
      $dbh->displayError();
   }
   # Gather Results of Query
   while ((@results) = $dbh->fetchResults()) {                        
      if (!defined @results) {
         $dbh->displayError();
      }
      # Display customers ban and bill cycle
      print STDOUT "Ban: $results[0] -> Bill Cycle: $results[1]\n";   
   }
   # Close DB Connection
   $dbh->closeConnection();
